item.description:
Hi .. .

Lets have some Fun, explore the Fells, and take our pups for a hike ...

Being early in the season I am not sure how adventurous you want to get with the terrain so lets pick the path, at the board, that will bring us on a 1.5 - 2 hour adventure with the possibility of including a bit of the skyline trail.

Here's hoping you'll put on your boots, grab your pup(s), bring some water, and join Breezy and I at the fells. ... & On the off chance it rains cats and dogs ... right now there is a 30% chance of showers ... we'll look at another day.

Hope to see you There!

Chat soon,

Kristan Dean

How to Get There:
MBTA:
Orange Line to Wellington Station, MBTA bus #100 to Roosevelt Circle Rotary, walk south to the rotary, turn right on South Border Road, Bellevue Pond is 1/5 mile right on South Border Road. Sheepfold section exit on Elm Street, walk north on Route 28 about one mile underneath the overpass, sign is on the left.

By Car:
From North 93 South to exit 35 at stop take a left under highway at next stop sign take a right at first set of lights (rt28) take a right for Sheepfold entrance.

From south 93 North to exit 33(RT28N) for Sheepfold - go N 1.8 miles to reservation entrance. Follow the road inside to the parking lot.


Trail maps for the Middlesex Fells Reservation can be purchased at the following locations:

* Appalachian Mountain Club, 5 Joy St., Boston
* Book Ends, 559 Main St., Winchester
* Book Oasis, 297 Main St., Stoneham
* Book Rack, 13 Medford St., Arlington
* Globe Corner Bookstore, Harvard Sq., Cambridge
* Porter Square Books, Porter Sq., Cambridge
* REI, 279 Salem St., Rte 128, exit 40, Reading
* Or call the Friends of Middlesex Fells Reservation at 781 662 2340
item.how_to_find_us: At the bulletin board. I'll be the brunette with Breezy my whte puff Bichon.
item.name: Lets Explore Middlesex Fells
